remarks: Anything times the zero vector is the zero vector.  Equation 1b of [Kreyszig] p. 51.  (Contributed by NM, 24-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
vc0.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` W ) $.
vc0.2 $e |- S = ( 2nd ` W ) $.
vc0.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
vc0.4 $e |- Z = ( GId ` G ) $.
vcz $p |- ( ( W e. CVecOLD /\ A e. CC ) -> ( A S Z ) = Z ) $.
